results.title: Look inside: the story of a project
results.creator_credit: Gibbs Films and Document Film Services
results.brief_description: Intended for showing to primary school children before embarking on a project about the mouth. The films includes highlights of the Dorset primary school children’s project on dental health featured in the companion film “Out of the Mouths”.

results.title: Long Shadows the Legacy of the American Civil War
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the legacy of the American Civil War and its effect upon the politics and people of the south in the 1980s. Interviews with Robert Penn Warren, Studs Terkel, Jimmy Carter and others.

results.title: London terminus
results.brief_description: From London a vast national railway system radiates: at the railway terminus in London, 1,704 trains enter and leave the station every day. Millions of urban workers depend entirely on the railway system for their daily transport to and from central London, and, in addition, there are many expresses and goods trains which span the length and breadth of Great Britain. Music composed by Horace Somerville, played by London Symphony Orchestra under Muir Mathieson.

results.title: The Food Connection (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Can You Avoid Cancer?”.
Some major cancers seem to follow the Western way of life, and many surprising clues point towards our food The members of a family look at their typical eating habits and try some changes which could keep them healthier.

results.title: Work and play (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Can You Avoid Cancer?”.
What are the risks of getting cancer from substances you breathe in or handle at work? Or from air pollution? Or from sitting in the sun? This program looks at the links between cancer and industry, and suggests some steps for preventing even more cancer deaths in the future

results.title: Loading the Dice(TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Can You Avoid Cancer?”.
This series aims to promote a better understanding of what cancer is and to develop a more hopeful and less emotional attitude to the disease. This program answers common questions and looks at the reasons why epidemiology could hold the clues to possible prevention.

results.title: Living with dust
results.brief_description: Made for the Audio Visual Communications Centre, Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Co., the film presents causes of dust in nature and industry and gives methods of controlling these conditions. It tells how different dusts affect workers and what can be done to protect them.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 102
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Mixing of two unnamed chemicals to make a foam splint for broken limbs; fibre optics and the use in everyday life; lipids and their use in eradicating mosquitos and also in dispersing oil spills.
